name: industry
content:
industry noun
(PRODUCTION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ U ] the companies and activities involved in the process of producing goods for sale, especially in a factory or special area: trade and industry industry and commerce The city needs to attract more industry. The strike seriously reduced coal deliveries to industry.
More examplesFewer examplesThe government is trying to attract industry to the area .Is industry getting a rough deal from the EU?The state of Michigan has endowed three institutes to do research for industry.Most of the country's industry is in the Northwest.He was honoured for his distinguished service in industry.

industry noun
(TYPE OF WORK)
B1 [ C ] the people and activities involved in one type of business: the gas/electricity industry the tourist industry manufacturing industries The computer industry has been booming.
[ C ] disapproving something that is produced or is available in large quantities and makes a lot of money: the heritage industry
More examplesFewer examplesThe government was determined to reduce the number of state-owned industries.The redundancies are spread across the clothing, banking and building industries.Service industries such as tourism have become more important in the post-industrial age.The chemical industry produces such things as petrochemicals, drugs, paint and rubber.She works in the construction industry.
